sen.j: 市街地の北から東にかけては六国見山（147メートル）、大平山（159メートル）、天台山（141メートル）、衣張山（120メートル）などの低い山が連なり、逗子市との境に当たる飯島ヶ崎、和賀江島（わかえじま）方面へ伸びている。

sen.j: 康平6年（1063年）源頼義は由比郷鶴岡（鎌倉市材木座）に「鶴岡若宮」として、河内源氏の氏神である河内国石川郡壷井の壷井八幡宮を勧請した。

sen.j: この年は、源頼義が陸奥の安倍貞任を討ち、前九年の役が終結した翌年である。
sen.e: It is the following year when MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi defeated Sadato ABE in Mutsu and the Zen Kunen no Eki (Former Nine Years' War) came to an end.

sen.e: After the war, he thanked Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine in the suburb of Kyoto for the victory and called on its deity to found Tsuboi Hachiman-gu Shrine at Tsuboi, Kawachi Province, the foothold of the clan.

sen.j: それから20年後の治承4年（1180年）、以仁王が頼政の嫡子の「前伊豆守」源仲綱を通じて全国の源氏に発した令旨を奉じた頼朝は、流刑先の伊豆で平氏打倒の兵を挙げる。
sen.e: Twenty years later, in 1180, Yoritomo received Prince Mochihito's ryoji (orders issued by princes, empresses, etc) given to the Minamoto clan all over the country through MINAMOTO no Nakatsuna, the former Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province) and a legitimate son of Yorimasa, and raised an army in Izu, a place of exile, to defeat the Taira clan.

sen.j: この当時（12世紀末～13世紀初頭）は、京都の中央政府（院政）の力も衰えておらず、中央（都、首都）と鎌倉の二元的支配体制であった。

sen.j: 承久3年（1221年）の承久の乱（後鳥羽上皇が倒幕を企て、北条義時の追討を命じるが、失敗して隠岐に配流される）以後、鎌倉側の政治的優位は決定的となり、鎌倉は名実共に、日本の行政府所在地となったといえる。
sen.e: After the Jokyu War in 1221 (in which the retired the Emperor Gotoba having a plot to overthrow the Bakufu issued an order to defeat Yoshitoki HOJO but failed and was banished to Oki Province), the Kamakura government started to hold a decisive political power, making Kamakura the seat of administration of Japan both nominally and virtually.

sen.e: It is well known as its huge Kannon-zo (statue of the Kannon).

tit.j: 鎌倉のハイキングコース

sen.j: 海に面する南を除く、北・東・西の三方を山で囲まれる鎌倉には、豊かな自然を楽しむことができるハイキングコースがある。
sen.e: Kamakura surrounded by mountains on its three sides--the east, north, and west--except the north facing the sea has several hiking courses along which people can enjoy its rich natural environment.

Kamakura is surrounded by mountains on its three sides--the east, north, and west--except the north facing the sea, and has several hiking courses along which people can enjoy its rich natural environment.

Kamakura is surrounded by mountains on its three sides--the east, north, and west--except the south facing the sea, and has several hiking courses along which people can enjoy its rich natural environment.

sen.j: 鎌倉の山は標高１００メートル程度と比較的手軽に楽しめることもあり、特に休日は多くのハイカーでにぎわっている。
sen.e: Many hikers enjoy hiking in mountains in Kamakura particularly in holidays partly because mountains in Kamakura, about 100 meters above the sea, can be enjoyed relatively easily.

sen.j: 1900年（明治33年）5月発表の『鉄道唱歌』第1集東海道編（大和田建樹作詞、全64番）では、東海道本線を外れてわざわざ横須賀線に入り、鎌倉に4番を割いている。
sen.e: Song of "Tetsudo Shoka (Songs of Railways)," released in May 1900 as the first collection of the songs, diverges the Tokaido Main Line and enters all the way the Yokosuka Line to include Kamakura in its four verses.

Song of "Tetsudo Shoka (Songs of Railways)," released in May 1900 as the first collection of the songs, diverges the Tokaido Main Line and enters all the way the Yokosuka Line to include Kamakura in its four verses.

Song of "Tetsudo Shoka" (Songs of Railways), released in May 1900 as the first collection of the songs (lyrics by Tateki OWADA and 64 verses in total), diverges the Tokaido Main Line and enters all the way the Yokosuka Line to include Kamakura in its four verses.

sen.j: 作者が京都市・近江八景・太宰府天満宮など歴史的な土地に相当な執着を持っていたからと言われる。
sen.e: This is because the songwriter is said to have had an ardent attachment to historical places such as Kyoto city, the Eight Views of Omi, and Dazaifu Tenman-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 鎌倉に関しては後には葉山に別荘を構えたりもした。
sen.e: When it comes to Kamakura, he later kept a villa in Hayama.

sen.e: The 6th verse: Nest to Ofuna called a station for changing the train for Yokosuka is Kamakura to visit and see Tsurugaoka and historical sites of the Minamoto clan.
